reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from 2 nights here.
reviews.title: A hidden gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Found service to be highly personalized by everyone we encountered. All of the staff went out of their way to help with the simplest of our requests (i.e., the girl at the bell desk went on line to calculate time/distances between train stations to ensure we allowed enough time not to be late for a reservation!).
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel in Quiet Neighbourhood

reviews.text: Booked on cash and points and the only option at time of rez was 2 single beds. Asked at check-in for a king bed but agent gave me a dumbfounded glare and re-confirmed my request for 2 beds. Since my knowledge of the language is non-existant, I didn't pursue it. And to be honest, it was nice not having anyone steal my covers for two nights! At $60 per night (converted to 5700 Yen) this was a bargain!
reviews.title: Another nice hotel in Tokyo

reviews.text: On arrival from NRT, we stopped by the JR Service Center and purchased the NEX/Suica combo. Had found directions on hotel website to give to driver once we arrived at Shinagawa Stn. which worked like clock-work. On our second day, we actually ventured back from Shinagawa Stn on foot and discovered a lovely residential neighbourhood with a school and temple within it. In all, it was a slow 25 minute walk with a few wrong turns along the way!
reviews.title: great hotel, good price and location not that bad

reviews.text: We used the shuttle to Meguro Stn a number of times and highly recommend it! We also walked down the street one time to Meguro Stn once so we could do some window shopping and stop into the 100 Yen store. Our first night, we were able to find the supermarket to pick up some Saki (to bring home) and some pastries and OJ to make our own Gold Member's continental breakfast!
reviews.title: High quality, with a friendly ambiance

reviews.text: I was staying at Sheraton Miyako in June for one week with a number of colleagues and the fact that there were many of us in the same hotel helped to make some observations regarding the rooms and services. Overall, I would seriously suggest that the hotel either lowers its prices and rates itself as a 3 star hotel max, or does some changes quickly.
reviews.title: Below Sheraton standards, SPG membership means little

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1. Room sizes vary *A LOT*..! Some of my colleagues managed to get a room at least twice as large as mine, whereas some of us were housed in rooms that were truly tiny - some of the smallest rooms I have seen anywhere inclusive of motels and express hotels!! I had a large nice bed in my room, but with the other somewhat oversized furniture (TV-cabinet/minibar combo, a small mini couch, tiny round "work table" and a chair) there, there was barely enough room for me to walk between the minicouche and my bed!! So beware and ask for a new larger room if you get stuffed in one of these "cubicles". And yes, even SPG Platinum and Gold members are put in these tiny rooms - forget about upgrades..
reviews.title: Very nice...from the inside

reviews.text: 2. If you arrive before 1PM, most likely your room will not be ready and you must wait, despite of giving the hotel a warning about an early arrival / not. And this goes also for Gold & Platinum SPG members.
reviews.title: Slightly disappointed

reviews.text: 3. About the swimmingpool: It is stated that it is open until 9PM, however after 8PM SHARP you will not be allowed in. I gather they are worried about being able to close the place precisely as the clock strikes 9PM. No exceptions to this rule.
reviews.title: Outdated Rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 4. There is a very nice Bose radio / clock set in every room on the tiny round desk, but the TV's are well outdated and often as small as 17" screens. Very few channels exist to watch in a language other than Japanese.
reviews.title: Price is excellent, but too much smoking everywhere....

reviews.text: the rooms are excellent. Tokyo is expensive city but this hotel has a price ressonable.
reviews.title: Swimpool in Tokyo ! ! !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you book a room here you have acess to the 25 meters pool located in the gym club on the groung floor for free. The free buffet breakfast is excellent and all the personnel say "good morning" "hello" "have a nice day" etc all the time.
reviews.title: An off-located Four Star Hotel in Tokyo

likes.liked: — The lobby area and the look of the rooms.
likes.disliked: — The location and the small bathroom.

reviews.title: Very Nice Business/Tourist Hotel
reviews.text: Service is always quick and you may ask whatever information about the city, Japan or whatever you need to the two persons located in the lobby. They know absolutely everything.
A convenient bus drives you to Megureo metro station for free every 15 minutes. There is connection from the hotel to Narita Airport.
reviews.title: Great hotel & Staff

likes.disliked: — the hotel food wasn't that good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I recently stayed at the Sheraton Miyako Hotel - An off-located Four Star Hotel.
reviews.title: Little out of the way

reviews.text: I'll preface the value part in that I used a few of my Starwood reward points to snag a $45 per night rate. As others have pointed out the location is not in the middle of the "action" or main sight-seeing clusters. That said, the free shuttle to both Meguro and Shinagawa JR train stations is very convenient. There is a subway stop on the Tokyo Metro that is about a 5 minute walk away. We used all three transportation stations and were able to get to all sights with relative ease, so I wouldn't be too worried about the location. In fact, it's nice to return to an area that's NOT crowded and a bit more relaxed.
reviews.title: Great value and staff

likes.liked: — Shuttle service and the hotel staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were what you'd expect for this level of property with clean rooms, firm beds, etc. They also have those fancy Japanese bidet toilets I miss so much now that I'm back home.
reviews.title: Loved It!

reviews.text: The staff at this hotel was excellent during my visit. From the time we arrived, during our stay and when we departed, the staff was very attentive to our needs. The one nit is the service in the California Cafe is a bit spotty in a very minor sense where food doesn't come all at once (not that late either).
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Excellent Service, Not A Good Location

reviews.text: We split our visit to Japan (Tokyo-Kyoto-Tokyo) so we were able to leave one of our bags behind for storage and everything worked out great.
reviews.title: the worst 4* experience in my life
Loved the luxiry and the hospitality!
reviews.text: I'd stay here again if I return to Tokyo.

reviews.title: quiet, classy and well run
reviews.text: A busness trip brought me to the Radisson Miyako, Tokyo in the middle April of 2005.

This is a nice clean renovated hotel but the location is not walking distance to any of the big sites or areas of Tokyo. The service is great and the price is great for Tokyo but you will need to take the subway/train to see the real sites of Tokyo. If you dont mind being in a quiet residential area then this hotel is for you. They have a bus to take you to train station or you can walk 5-7 mins to the subway station. At night there are not many options to eat in the area but if you want a good priced well serviced hotel then this place is for you. Keep in mind you need to take the subway or train all the time since Tokyo is so large... but if you stay in Shinjuku, Shibuya or Ginza there is a lot to see in walking distance. I would only stay here again because of the reasonable price and if I just wanted a place to rest at night.
reviews.title: Nice clean hotel with good service... OK location

reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel for one week for business.
reviews.title: More good than bad...

reviews.text: There is a direct bus from Narita for 3000 yen. If you are tired from your trip, it's nice not to have to haul luggage through the train stations (the alternate way to get here). You just walk 20 ft outside and hop on the charter-style bus and in 1.5hrs it pulls up to the door of the hotel. The train is slightly faster but if you don't know what you are doing with respect to the trains you could end up talking longer.
reviews.title: Can't Use the Pool
Excellent Choice!
reviews.text: There's not much around the hotel, but a free shuttle runs you to a nearby Japan Rail station every 15 minutes, and there are a few nice restaurants around there. The concierge is superb: friendly, helpful, and patient. They have lots of custom printed info for you to help you navigate Tokyo (which can be tricky for new visitors."

This hotel is dated. It feels like it's from the 70s. However, it was well built and appointed nicely, so it's not run down by any means. However, the gym is pathetic, so if exercise is important to you, you might be served better elsewhere (or plan on going to a separate gym). I am surprised they advertise having a gym at all... it is basically a couple of treadmill, some barbells, and a couple of dated looking machines. To add insult to injury, they charge you to use it!
reviews.title: Exceptional hotel!

likes.disliked: — You have to take a subway or train to get to the tourist spots

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: very nice hotel. the concierge was OUTSTANDING. very helpful. easy shuttle service to nearby food/light shopping/train station.
reviews.title: would stay here

reviews.text: Didn't eat there so I can't comment on foods.
reviews.title: A nice business haven - good value for its level and amenities
Great hotel, Very expensive
reviews.text: Heated toliet seats need to catch on around the world. (they have them).
Bus picks up and drops off here to go to the airport...reccommend that too.
reviews.title: Great Service, Even for an Asian Hotel

reviews.text: would stay here again.
reviews.title: Great Staff and Hotel

reviews.text: this is a very nice hotel....but not worth how expensive it is. the room smelled faintly of smoke, but was clean. the hotel is off the beaten track but they do provide free drop off and pick up service from the nearby train stations. the guest relations are helfpful as well. there is no safe in the room, although there is a mini bar. (once you take things out of the minibar it is automatically charged to your bill- so if you take things out so that you can put your own things in, make sure to check your bill). Also, there were a lot of hidden service fees we were not expecting added to our bill upon check out.
reviews.title: not worth the amount

likes.liked: — the shuttle service and guest relation desk

reviews.text: On my recent Japan trip, I stayed at Sheraton Yokohama Bay and then at this hotel. Again, the Sheraton staff are extremely friendly and remain diligent at doing their jobs; rooms are cleaned superbly.
reviews.title: Sheraton Miyako Tokyo - Not Bad

likes.liked: — The free Internet service, the rooms, and the convenience to Tokyo

reviews.text: The shuttle bus to Meguro Station and to Shinagawa Station in the mornings is convenient. The shuttle bus drivers are courteous as well.
reviews.title: Great hotel in outskirts of Tokyo
Excellent hotel
reviews.text: However, I find that the lavatories are a bit old and could use some refurbishing. This hotel is older than the Sheraton Yokahama Bay so I suspect the age of the hotel is the problem. Also, the TVs are too small.
This is not a bad hotel, but it is not one of the most glamorous in Tokyo. With a few changes, I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay at the Miyako

likes.liked: — Proximity to our Tokyo office, and fantastic comfortable beds.
